title: Moloch's Sanctum
data:
| Moloch's Sanctum                                    |                                                      |
| --------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Location                                            | Level 20–24 of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") |
| [Bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones")                        | No                                                   |
| [Mappable](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping")     | No                                                   |
| [Teleportable](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation") | No                                                   |
| [Diggable floor](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                                   |
| [Diggable walls](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                                   |

**Moloch's Sanctum** is a special dungeon level. It is always the lowest dungeon level, the 20th–24th level of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), and so Dungeon Level 45–53. To enter it you must perform the [invocation](/wiki/Invocation "Invocation"). This is the level that contains the real [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"). [Magic mapping](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping") does not work here, although the only variable in the map is the location of the secret door to the temple.

The entire level is [non-teleport](/wiki/Non-teleport_level "Non-teleport level") and ineligible to leave [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Map](#Map)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [2.1 Typical methodology](#Typical_methodology)
  - [2.2 The high priest is initially peaceful](#The_high_priest_is_initially_peaceful)
  - [2.3 Things not to do](#Things_not_to_do)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)

- [5 References](#References)

## Map

                                       |||                                       
                                       |||                                       
                --------------         |||                                       
                |............|         ||| -------                               
          -------............-----     ||| |.....|                               
          |......................|     |||--.....|            ---------          
       ----....[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap").......---------|......----         |.......|          
       |.......[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")---------[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap").........|......[+](/wiki/Door "Door").........|     ------[+](/wiki/Door "Door")---..|          
     ---.......[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")|.......|[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap").........--[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")----|[Graveyard](/wiki/Graveyard "Graveyard")|     |........|..|          
     |.........[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")|...[\_](/wiki/Altar "Altar")...|[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")............|||||.........------|..----------          
     |.........[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")|.[Temple](/wiki/Temple "Temple")|[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap").........----||||..........|....|..|......|            
     |.........[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")|.......|[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap").........|   |||--.......----[+](/wiki/Door "Door")---[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")---[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")--..|            
     |.........[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")---------[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap").........|   ||| |.......|.............|..|            
     ---.......[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap")[^](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap").........|   ||| -----[+](/wiki/Door "Door")-------[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")---------[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")---           
       |...........................|   |||    |...| |......|    |....---         
       ----.....................----   |||    |...---....---  ---......|         
          |.....................|      |||    |..........|    |..[<](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase")..----         
          -------...........-----      |||    --...-------    |.....|            
                |...........|          |||     |...|          |.....|            
                -------------          |||     -----          -------            
                                       |||                                     

The room marked as **Temple** is the [temple](/wiki/Temple "Temple") housing the [high priest of Moloch](/wiki/High_priest_of_Moloch "High priest of Moloch") carrying [the Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/The_Amulet_of_Yendor "The Amulet of Yendor"). The entrance to the temple is a [secret door](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door") randomly placed on one of the four walls (shown in blue above). The traps surrounding the temple are [fire traps](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap").

The high priest attending the temple of Moloch has, in addition to his usual priestly accoutrements, the Amulet of Yendor. The courtyard surrounding his temple contains nine [priests of Moloch](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest"), a [horned devil](/wiki/Horned_devil "Horned devil"), a [barbed devil](/wiki/Barbed_devil "Barbed devil"), an [erinys](/wiki/Erinys "Erinys"), a [marilith](/wiki/Marilith "Marilith"), and a [nalfeshnee](/wiki/Nalfeshnee "Nalfeshnee"); in addition to the standard undead in the marked graveyard, the level also contains two random [L](/wiki/Lich_\(monster_class\) "Lich (monster class)") and three random [V](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)"). The temple is surrounded by [fire traps](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap"), and a secret door is placed randomly on one wall; there are also two more fire traps, a [spiked pit](/wiki/Spiked_pit "Spiked pit"), a [magic trap](/wiki/Magic_trap "Magic trap"), an [anti-magic trap](/wiki/Anti-magic_trap "Anti-magic trap"), and a [sleeping gas trap](/wiki/Sleeping_gas_trap "Sleeping gas trap") randomly elsewhere on the level. Four pieces of [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor"), two [tools](/wiki/Tool "Tool"), a [gem](/wiki/Gem "Gem"), four [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") and five [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") are randomly located about the level, as well as the usual [chests](/wiki/Chest "Chest") in the graveyard. All walls are undiggable. Also, the (marked in purple above) dividing line between the two halves of the level cannot be phased through by polyself into a [xorn](/wiki/Xorn "Xorn") or [earth elemental](/wiki/Earth_elemental "Earth elemental").

## Strategy

### Typical methodology

Using a light source of some kind is helpful because most of the level is unlit.

Because of the fire traps surrounding the temple it is desirable not to have to pace along each wall **s**earching for the door. If you have any charges remaining in the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening"), applying it on each wall will identify the door, as will a [wand of secret door detection](/wiki/Wand_of_secret_door_detection "Wand of secret door detection"). In a pinch you could also use a [stethoscope](/wiki/Stethoscope "Stethoscope"), as a single use does not take a turn.

Once inside the temple, the goal is to kill the high priest as fast as possible and get out. Once the priest is killed, attacking monsters is no longer a priority (except for the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor"), should he appear). For this reason it is handy to have thinned out the crowd in the graveyard before entering the temple.

The priest will always drop the Amulet of Yendor. The first thing you want to do upon picking it up is #[name](/wiki/Name "Name") it "Real" or similar, to distinguish it from the fake amulets that may appear with the return of the Wizard.

### The high priest is initially peaceful

[![](/images/thumb/c/c7/Sanctum.png/280px-Sanctum.png)](/wiki/File:Sanctum.png)



Player about to kill the [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest").

Using ranged attacks to kill the high priest can be a good idea, but a pitfall waits for the unwary. If you attack the high priest without first entering the temple, it is considered an attack on a peaceful human, and killing him will then incur the penalty for [murder](/wiki/Murder "Murder"). Be sure, then, that you have entered the temple and that the high priest has said:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

```
Infidel, you have entered Moloch's Sanctum!  Be gone!
```

At that point the high priest is hostile and fair game.

### Things not to do

Do not by any means try to convert Moloch's High Altar. If you do, Moloch will zap you with [lightning](/wiki/Lightning "Lightning") and a [wide-angle disintegration beam](/wiki/Wide-angle_disintegration_beam "Wide-angle disintegration beam"), which means [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath") for nonresistant characters and possibly item loss for resistant ones. It's still possible to summon [Juiblex](/wiki/Juiblex "Juiblex") or other named demons by doing a same-race sacrifice on the High Altar though.

## History

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and prior versions, it was possible to land anywhere in the level when arriving via [levelport](/wiki/Levelport "Levelport"). This was fixed in [commit 5ff9b37b](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/5ff9b37ba4266f96d2d27d7209bf55f15ecde4ff), included in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"), by using a [teleport region](/wiki/Teleport_region "Teleport region") that limits arrival to the rightmost third of the level.

Also in 3.4.3 and earlier, [covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") monsters that want the Amulet of Yendor would fight the High Priest of Moloch for it. This was patched out in [commit 9df113a9](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9df113a97308492a50ebbfea8ad75a3a86f3cecd), included in 3.6.0.

## UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), the [high priest of Moloch](/wiki/High_priest_of_Moloch "High priest of Moloch") is replaced by [Cthulhu](/wiki/Cthulhu "Cthulhu").

The exterior of the Sanctum is lava, the middle choke-point is a pair of [drawbridges](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge") over lava, and there are two [wands of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking") randomly placed in the temple half of the level, so players should be careful about crossing the drawbridges.

Recent versions also contain a few [shambling horrors](/wiki/Shambling_horror "Shambling horror").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/priest.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 429](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/priest.c#L429)

*This page is based on a spoiler by [Dylan O'Donnell](https://alt.org/nethack/mirror/www.spod-central.org/%257Epsmith/). The original license is:*

Redistribution, copying, and editing of these spoilers, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

1. The original contributors to any spoiler must continue to be credited.
2. Any modifications to the spoiler must be acknowledged and credited.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Moloch's Sanctum

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Moloch's Sanctum
Location Level 20–24 of
Gehennom
Bones No
Mappable No
Teleportable No
Diggable floor No
Diggable walls No

Moloch's Sanctum is a special dungeon level. It is always the lowest dungeon level, the 20th–24th level of Gehennom, and so Dungeon Level 45–53. To enter it you must perform the invocation. This is the level that contains the real Amulet of Yendor. Magic mapping does not work here, although the only variable in the map is the location of the secret door to the temple.

The entire level is non-teleport and ineligible to leave bones.

Contents

  • 1 Map
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 Typical methodology
    • 2.2 The high priest is initially peaceful
    • 2.3 Things not to do
  • 3 History
  • 4 UnNetHack
  • 5 References

Map

                                       |||                                     
                                       |||                                     
                --------------         |||                                     
                |............|         ||| -------                             
          -------............-----     ||| |.....|                             
          |......................|     |||--.....|            ---------        
       ----....^^^^^^^^^^^.......---------|......----         |.......|        
       |.......^---------^.........|......+.........|     ------+---..|        
     ---.......^|.......|^.........--S----|Graveyard|     |........|..|        
     |.........^|..._...|^............|||||.........------|..----------        
     |.........^|.Temple|^.........----||||..........|....|..|......|          
     |.........^|.......|^.........|   |||--.......----+---S---S--..|          
     |.........^---------^.........|   ||| |.......|.............|..|          
     ---.......^^^^^^^^^^^.........|   ||| -----+-------S---------S---         
       |...........................|   |||    |...| |......|    |....---       
       ----.....................----   |||    |...---....---  ---......|       
          |.....................|      |||    |..........|    |..<..----       
          -------...........-----      |||    --...-------    |.....|          
                |...........|          |||     |...|          |.....|          
                -------------          |||     -----          -------          
                                       |||                                     

The room marked as Temple is the temple housing the high priest of Moloch carrying the Amulet of Yendor. The entrance to the temple is a secret door randomly placed on one of the four walls (shown in blue above). The traps surrounding the temple are fire traps.

The high priest attending the temple of Moloch has, in addition to his usual priestly accoutrements, the Amulet of Yendor. The courtyard surrounding his temple contains nine priests of Moloch, a horned devil, a barbed devil, an erinys, a marilith, and a nalfeshnee; in addition to the standard undead in the marked graveyard, the level also contains two random L and three random V. The temple is surrounded by fire traps, and a secret door is placed randomly on one wall; there are also two more fire traps, a spiked pit, a magic trap, an anti-magic trap, and a sleeping gas trap randomly elsewhere on the level. Four pieces of armor, two tools, a gem, four potions and five scrolls are randomly located about the level, as well as the usual chests in the graveyard. All walls are undiggable. Also, the (marked in purple above) dividing line between the two halves of the level cannot be phased through by polyself into a xorn or earth elemental.

Strategy

Typical methodology

Using a light source of some kind is helpful because most of the level is unlit.

Because of the fire traps surrounding the temple it is desirable not to have to pace along each wall searching for the door. If you have any charges remaining in the Bell of Opening, applying it on each wall will identify the door, as will a wand of secret door detection. In a pinch you could also use a stethoscope, as a single use does not take a turn.

Once inside the temple, the goal is to kill the high priest as fast as possible and get out. Once the priest is killed, attacking monsters is no longer a priority (except for the Wizard of Yendor, should he appear). For this reason it is handy to have thinned out the crowd in the graveyard before entering the temple.

The priest will always drop the Amulet of Yendor. The first thing you want to do upon picking it up is #name it "Real" or similar, to distinguish it from the fake amulets that may appear with the return of the Wizard.

The high priest is initially peaceful

Player about to kill the high priest.

Using ranged attacks to kill the high priest can be a good idea, but a pitfall waits for the unwary. If you attack the high priest without first entering the temple, it is considered an attack on a peaceful human, and killing him will then incur the penalty for murder. Be sure, then, that you have entered the temple and that the high priest has said:[1] 

Infidel, you have entered Moloch's Sanctum!  Be gone!

At that point the high priest is hostile and fair game.

Things not to do

Do not by any means try to convert Moloch's High Altar. If you do, Moloch will zap you with lightning and a wide-angle disintegration beam, which means instadeath for nonresistant characters and possibly item loss for resistant ones. It's still possible to summon Juiblex or other named demons by doing a same-race sacrifice on the High Altar though.

History

In NetHack 3.4.3 and prior versions, it was possible to land anywhere in the level when arriving via levelport. This was fixed in commit 5ff9b37b, included in NetHack 3.6.0, by using a teleport region that limits arrival to the rightmost third of the level.

Also in 3.4.3 and earlier, covetous monsters that want the Amulet of Yendor would fight the High Priest of Moloch for it. This was patched out in commit 9df113a9, included in 3.6.0.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, the high priest of Moloch is replaced by Cthulhu.

The exterior of the Sanctum is lava, the middle choke-point is a pair of drawbridges over lava, and there are two wands of striking randomly placed in the temple half of the level, so players should be careful about crossing the drawbridges.

Recent versions also contain a few shambling horrors.

References

  1. ↑ src/priest.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 429

The entire level is [[non-teleport level|non-teleport]] and ineligible to leave [[bones]]. ==Map==

The room marked as '''Temple''' is the [[temple]] housing the [[high priest of Moloch]] carrying [[the Amulet of Yendor]]. The entrance to the temple is a [[secret door]] randomly placed on one of the four walls (shown in blue above). The traps surrounding the temple are [[fire trap]]s. The high priest attending the temple of Moloch has, in addition to his usual priestly accoutrements, the Amulet of Yendor. The courtyard surrounding his temple contains nine [[aligned priest|priests of Moloch]], a [[horned devil]], a [[barbed devil]], an [[erinys]], a [[marilith]], and a [[nalfeshnee]]; in addition to the standard undead in the marked graveyard, the level also contains two random {{mcsl|L}} and three random {{mcsl|V}}. The temple is surrounded by [[fire trap]]s, and a secret door is placed randomly on one wall; there are also two more fire traps, a [[spiked pit]], a [[magic trap]], an [[anti-magic trap]], and a [[sleeping gas trap]] randomly elsewhere on the level. Four pieces of [[armor]], two [[tool]]s, a [[gem]], four [[potion]]s and five [[scroll]]s are randomly located about the level, as well as the usual [[chest]]s in the graveyard. All walls are undiggable. Also, the (marked in purple above) dividing line between the two halves of the level cannot be phased through by polyself into a [[xorn]] or [[earth elemental]]. ==Strategy== ===Typical methodology=== Using a light source of some kind is helpful because most of the level is unlit. Because of the fire traps surrounding the temple it is desirable not to have to pace along each wall '''s'''earching for the door. If you have any charges remaining in the [[Bell of Opening]], applying it on each wall will identify the door, as will a [[wand of secret door detection]]. In a pinch you could also use a [[stethoscope]], as a single use does not take a turn. Once inside the temple, the goal is to kill the high priest as fast as possible and get out. Once the priest is killed, attacking monsters is no longer a priority (except for the [[Wizard of Yendor]], should he appear). For this reason it is handy to have thinned out the crowd in the graveyard before entering the temple. The priest will always drop the Amulet of Yendor. The first thing you want to do upon picking it up is #[[name]] it "Real" or similar, to distinguish it from the fake amulets that may appear with the return of the Wizard. === The high priest is initially peaceful === [[Image:Sanctum.png|thumb|right|280px|Player about to kill the [[high priest]].]] Using ranged attacks to kill the high priest can be a good idea, but a pitfall waits for the unwary. If you attack the high priest without first entering the temple, it is considered an attack on a peaceful human, and killing him will then incur the penalty for [[murder]]. Be sure, then, that you have entered the temple and that the high priest has said:{{refsrc|src/priest.c|429|nethack=3.6.7}} Infidel, you have entered Moloch's Sanctum! Be gone! At that point the high priest is hostile and fair game. === Things not to do === Do not by any means try to convert Moloch's High Altar. If you do, Moloch will zap you with [[lightning]] and a [[wide-angle disintegration beam]], which means [[instadeath]] for nonresistant characters and possibly item loss for resistant ones. It's still possible to summon [[Juiblex]] or other named demons by doing a same-race sacrifice on the High Altar though. ==History== In [[NetHack 3.4.3]] and prior versions, it was possible to land anywhere in the level when arriving via [[levelport]]. This was fixed in {{commit|5ff9b37ba4266f96d2d27d7209bf55f15ecde4ff}}, included in [[NetHack 3.6.0]], by using a [[teleport region]] that limits arrival to the rightmost third of the level. Also in 3.4.3 and earlier, [[covetous]] monsters that want the Amulet of Yendor would fight the High Priest of Moloch for it. This was patched out in {{commit|9df113a97308492a50ebbfea8ad75a3a86f3cecd}}, included in 3.6.0. ==UnNetHack== In [[UnNetHack]], the [[high priest of Moloch]] is replaced by [[Cthulhu]]. The exterior of the Sanctum is lava, the middle choke-point is a pair of [[drawbridge]]s over lava, and there are two [[wand of striking|wands of striking]] randomly placed in the temple half of the level, so players should be careful about crossing the drawbridges. Recent versions also contain a few [[shambling horror]]s. == References == {{DOD}} [[Category:Special levels]] {{nethack-367}}
